meanings.definition: To make something or someone seem more attractive or exciting
meanings.sent1: She used sparkly decorations to glamorise her room for the party.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover was glamorised with bright colors and bold text.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to glamorise itself by wearing a tiny bow tie.
meanings.sent4: The sunset glamorised the sky with hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The new dress design will glamorise the fashion show and make it unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more glamorous or desirable
meanings.sent1: The advertisement used celebrities to glamorise the product and increase sales.
meanings.sent2: Adding a touch of gold can glamorise even the simplest outfit.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to glamorise his act by wearing a top hat and cape.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion was glamorised by the soft glow of candlelight.
meanings.sent5: The fairy lights will glamorise the garden party and create a magical atmosphere.
